Sever loss of medicinal plants has revealed the necessity of serious efforts to create public awareness about value of medicinal plants in aid and semiarid ecosystems of Iran. Gradual loss of traditional knowledge has intensified harvesting of medicinal plants
54, 55 . In our study, medicinal plants were conserved more in rangelands under nomadism compared to sedentary pastoralism. Nomadism has less destructive effects on the rangelands due to limited exploitation months compared to sedentary pastoralism in which all year round the rangelands are exploited
56 . Nomads are in fact the real rangelands dwellers who have historically adapted to the rangelands
17 and have more experiences and information about the medicinal properties on plants
57, 58 .
